Params: {1: '1', 2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Time for the curtains to fall! Now all we need to do is take out the remaining Corrupted andâ€”', 4: '1'}
{3: 'As the banging of the drums and gongs fades away into a gentle hum, the pulley for the curtains begins to move, grinding through yellowed rust and dried grease.'}
{3: 'The pulley, rusty after fifty years of disuse, can no longer support the two-ton curtains. The set falls apart, slamming onto the stage, sending dust flying.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bunshiro', 3: 'My golden armor has been laid to rest. My twin blades sleep soundly in their sheaths...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bunshiro', 3: 'When spring comes around, to the mountains I shall go, and there I will bow down low...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bunshiro', 3: "I will bow to the royal guards... to the hawk-eyed warrior's bow... to Princess Linghua, who has left home... and to General Xu, who inspects his troops...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'His unaccompanied soliloquy finished, it is time for Bunshiro to exit the stage.'}
{3: 'Except, it may even be one verse too many for him.'}
{3: 'Bunshiro, for his part, remains unaffected. The feedback from his receiver tells him that the long-awaited end has finally come.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Let him be. We should start searching for the CPF in the Glazed Arch.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: "We gotta thank him, then. Isn't that it, right there?", 4: '2'}
{3: "Where the curtains were mounted upon the ceiling, a giant hole now gapes skyward. It looks like the pulleys weren't the only thing dragged down by the finale."}
{3: 'Through the hole, faintly, one could make out the vague outline of the CPF tower.'}
